clauses.question: 1. What process should the Government use to set a new emissions reduction target in legislation?
clauses.notes:
The government should not be setting any targets at all. There is no evidence that supports the theory that the level of carbon

 dioxide in the atmosphere affects the earth's climate.

clauses.question: 2. If the Government sets a 2050 target now, which is the best target for New Zealand?
clauses.notes:
The best target is no target. Our carbon emissions on world wide scale are minimal and cancelled out but emissions from larger
 emitters such as India, China, Russia.

clauses.question: 3. How should New Zealand meet its targets?
clauses.notes:
Withdraw from the Paris Agreement and put the money saved into supporting work to return the natural environment to it's best and
 forget about climate change. Climate change is an natural cycle that is very complex and not well understood by the scientific
 community. Climate change will occur regardless of what we do.

clauses.question: 4. Should the Zero Carbon Bill allow the 2050 target to be revised if circumstances change?
clauses.notes: The bill should not go ahead at all. It's just virtue signalling and a sop to the Greens.

clauses.question: 5. The Government proposes that three emissions budgets of five years each (i.e. covering the next 15 years) be in place at any given time. Do you agree with this proposal?
clauses.notes: I do not agree that any targets need to be set. Refer to my earlier answers.

clauses.question: 6. Should the Government be able to alter the last emissions budget (i.e. furthest into the future)?
clauses.notes: The government should cut taxes for everyone and trim it's own expenditure. Forget about emissions.

clauses.question: 7. Should the Government have the ability to review and adjust the second emissions budget within a specific range under exceptional circumstances? See p36 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
Get onto things that are important such as reforming the RMA to enable more housing to be built. That's more important than a

 fantasy about affecting climate change.

clauses.question: 8. Do you agree with the considerations we propose that the Government and the Climate Change Commission take into account when advising on and setting budgets? See p44 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
No agreement on any considerations or actions taken by this government all all since it came into power. Reinstate the Oil and Gas

 industry, that will do more for the country overall than this load of nonsense.

clauses.question: 9. Should the Zero Carbon Bill require Governments to set out plans within a certain timeframe to achieve the emissions budgets?
clauses.notes:
This government has proven itself unable to plan and has done away with the targets in various areas the previous government had,

such as in Health. Setting out plans would all be for show anyway. you will not measure anything and will falsify any results anyway.

clauses.question: 10. What are the most important issues for the Government to consider in setting plans to meet budgets? For example, who do we need to work with, what else needs to be considered?
clauses.notes:
The most important issues for the government to consider is not to make a whole range of uncosted promises and then tax the living
daylights out of the country to try and pay for them.

clauses.question: 11. The Government has proposed that the Climate Change Commission advises on and monitors New Zealand's progress towards its goals. Do you agree with these functions? See p42 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: Time to reduce the number of useless commissions, might as well start with this one.

clauses.question: 12. What role do you think the Climate Change Commission should have in relation to the New Zealand Emissions Trading Scheme (NZ ETS)?
clauses.notes: Scrap the commission and scrap the NZ ETS, it's a total waste of time and taxpayer's money

clauses.question: 13. The Government has proposed that Climate Change Commissioners need to have a range of essential and desirable expertise. Do you agree with the proposed expertise? See p45 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes:
Scrap this commission, it's just the latest in the hundreds of inquiries, committees and commissions that have been set up to waste

taxpayer money while looking like you're doing something, yet achieving nothing.

clauses.question: 14. Do you think the Zero Carbon Bill should cover adapting to climate change?
clauses.notes: We do not need a Zero Carbon bill. We can adapt to climate change without it.

clauses.question: 15. The Government has proposed a number of new functions to help us adapt to climate change. Do you agree with the proposed functions? See p47 Our Climate Your Say
clauses.notes: Government and local government should stick to its knitting and stop inventing new ways of wasting taxpayer's money.

clauses.question: 16. Should we explore setting up a targeted adaptation reporting power that could see some organisations share information on their exposure to climate change risks?
clauses.notes: No - more time wasting and wasting taxpayer dollars

clauses.question: Do you have any other comments you'd like to make?
clauses.notes:
Before taking any action to interfere with the national economy or the lifestyle of its citizens, the government should provide
irrefutable proof that human production of carbon dioxide in New Zealand is harmful to humans or any other lifeforms in New Zealand.
